urls.title: Senator Kelly Loeffler of Georgia is in quarantine after testing positive for the virus.
urls.description: Senator Kelly Loeffler of Georgia, a Republican who is campaigning in a high-stakes runoff election that could determine control of the Senate, is quarantining after testing positive for the coronavirus.

text: Senator Kelly Loeffler, who faces a runoff in Georgia, is quarantining after a positive virus test and an inconclusive follow-up, her campaign said. https://t.co/DTnCUYemt4

urls.title: Brad Raffensperger, Georgia’s top election official, will certify Biden’s victory: ‘Numbers don’t lie.’
urls.description: Georgia’s secretary of state will formally declare President-elect Joe Biden the winner of the state’s 16 electoral votes, dealing a blow to President Trump’s effort to overturn the national election. Mr. Biden will meet with Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senator Chuck Schumer today. In a winner-take-all system, close margins of voters leads to fights that are as fierce after Election Day as the campaigns before. The passions we feel reflect voters’ commitment to the ideals and principles they believe in. We

text: Georgia’s secretary of state, a Republican and Trump supporter, will certify the state’s presidential election results on Friday, making official Joe Biden's win there. "I believe that the numbers that we have presented today are correct," he said. https://t.co/6H71oyksg8 https://t.co/4Br3J0QA43

Georgia’s secretary of state is set to certify the state’s presidential election results on Friday, making President-elect Joe Biden's victory there official. "I live by the motto that numbers don’t lie,” Brad Raffensperger, a Republican, said. https://t.co/99ofJPQxdo

urls.title: Hand Tally of Georgia Ballots Reaffirms Biden’s Win
urls.description: The audited vote totals showed that Joe Biden defeated President Trump in the state by 12,284 votes.

text:
Georgia’s statewide hand recount of more than five million ballots was completed on Thursday, reaffirming that President-elect Joe Biden notched an upset in a state that has long been considered a Republican stronghold.
https://t.co/8HCG3ETPUZ

urls.title: Republicans drop election suits in Georgia, Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin.
urls.description: President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. delivered remarks on the struggling economy amid the coronavirus pandemic. urls.title: America’s anti-democratic Senate, by the numbers
urls.description: If the United States chose its leaders in free and fair elections, Republicans would be firmly out of power.

text:
